article.headline: Loyola Marymnt 84, San Francisco 75 (2OT)
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Matthew Knight had 22 points and 15 rebounds to lead Loyola Marymount to an 84-75 double-overtime victory over San Francisco Monday. Knight scored four points in overtime, including a tip-in with 3:25 remaining in the second OT to put the Lions ahead for good. Loyola Marymount (5-11, 2-0 West Coast Conference) then built a four-point lead with 1:29 remaining on a 3-pointer by Jon Ziri. Wes Wardrop had 18 points for the Lions, Chris Ayer had 17 points and 10 rebounds and Brandon Worthy scored 14. Armondo Surratt had 23 points to lead the Dons (5-10, 1-1), who erased a 15-point halftime deficit, outscoring Loyola Marymount 41-26 in the second half. They tied the game, 61-61, on two free throws by Drew Shiller with 15 seconds left. San Francisco Coach Jessie Evans was ejected after two technical fouls with 14 seconds remaining. It is the first time Loyola Marymount has been 2-0 in conference since the 1989-90 season, the last time they were conference champions.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
